case.name: Purcell v APS Chemicals Superannuation Pty Ltd (Corrigendum dated 2 September 2009) [2009] FCA 981 (31 August 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: construction of total and permanent disablement under insurance policy
identification of relevant illnesses for purposes of assessment procedural fairness
whether failure to permit complainant to make oral submissions compromised right to procedural fairness
where entitlement to make oral submissions subject to statutory discretion
where complainant invited by tribunal to provide further written submissions
whether limited to persons who are financially dependent
whether tribunal satisfied s 40 of the superannuation (resolution of complaints) act 1993 (cth).

citances.sentence: The Complainant appealed from that determination to the Federal Court pursuant to s 46 of the Complaints Act. The Federal Court set aside the Tribunal's determination and ordered that the complaint be referred to the Tribunal to be determined in accordance with the directions contained in paragraph 42 of the Reasons for Judgement of the Court [1] . DETERMINATION OF THE TRIBUNAL
